issue.title: [Rust] [DataFusion] Investigate poor performance cited in towardsdatascience blog post
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9649](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9649). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
According to a recently published blog post [1] DataFuson is ~20x slower than Pandas for some simple queries against a tiny data set. I think it would be good to try and reproduce these results to understand why performance is so bad.

 [1] https://towardsdatascience.com/data-processing-in-rust-with-datafusion-arrow-56df5432de68

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9649?focusedCommentId=17171107) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
It looks like the numbers they published were based on running a debug release of DataFusion. I left a comment on the blog post. Hopefully they will update it.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9649?focusedCommentId=17171528) by Andy Grove (andygrove):*
They updated the blog. It now shows that DataFusion is "only" 3x slower than Pandas.
